question: "Change the element of all atoms that form bond TR000_2_3 to Sodium."
evidence: element = 'cl' means Chlorine; element = 'c' means Carbon; element = 'h' means Hydrogen; element = 'o' means Oxygen, element = 's' means Sulfur; element = 'n' means Nitrogen, element = 'p' means Phosphorus, element = 'na' means Sodium, element = 'br' means Bromine, element = 'f' means Fluorine; element = 'i' means Iodine; element = 'sn' means Tin; element = 'pb' means Lead; element = 'te' means Tellurium; element = 'ca' means Calcium
SQL: SELECT T2.element FROM connected AS T1 INNER JOIN atom AS T2 ON T1.atom_id = T2.atom_id WHERE T1.bond_id = 'TR000_2_3'
pg_sql: UPDATE atom SET element = 'na' FROM connected AS T1 WHERE T1.atom_id = atom.atom_id AND T1.bond_id = 'TR000_2_3'
base_pg_sql: SELECT T2.element FROM connected AS T1 INNER JOIN atom AS T2 ON T1.atom_id = T2.atom_id WHERE T1.bond_id = 'TR000_2_3'
base_question: Name the atoms' elements that form bond TR000_2_3.
base_evidence: element = 'cl' means Chlorine; element = 'c' means Carbon; element = 'h' means Hydrogen; element = 'o' means Oxygen, element = 's' means Sulfur; element = 'n' means Nitrogen, element = 'p' means Phosphorus, element = 'na' means Sodium, element = 'br' means Bromine, element = 'f' means Fluorine; element = 'i' means Iodine; element = 'sn' means Tin; element = 'pb' means Lead; element = 'te' means Tellurium; element = 'ca' means Calcium

gt.condition: SELECT atom.atom_id FROM atom, connected AS T1 WHERE T1.atom_id = atom.atom_id AND T1.bond_id = 'TR000_2_3'

question: Update the name to 'Hawkgirl' for all superheroes whose attribute value falls between 75 and 80.
evidence: names of superheroes refers to superhero_name; attribute value between 75 to 80 refers to attribute_value BETWEEN 75 AND 80;
SQL: SELECT T1.superhero_name FROM superhero AS T1 INNER JOIN hero_attribute AS T2 ON T1.id = T2.hero_id WHERE T2.attribute_value BETWEEN 75 AND 80
pg_sql: UPDATE superhero SET superhero_name = 'Hawkgirl' FROM hero_attribute AS T2 WHERE superhero.id = T2.hero_id AND T2.attribute_value BETWEEN 75 AND 80

base_evidence: names of superheroes refers to superhero_name; attribute value between 75 to 80 refers to attribute_value BETWEEN 75 AND 80;

question: Update the name of the school to 'George V. LeyVa Intermediate' for schools where more than 10% of students are eligible for free meals in K-12 and there is at least one student scoring 1500 or higher on the test.
evidence: Percent eligible for free meals = Free Meal Count (K-12) / Total (Enrollment (K-12)
SQL: SELECT T2.`School Name` FROM satscores AS T1 INNER JOIN frpm AS T2 ON T1.cds = T2.CDSCode WHERE CAST(T2.`Free Meal Count (K-12)` AS REAL) / T2.`Enrollment (K-12)` > 0.1 AND T1.NumGE1500 > 0
pg_sql: UPDATE frpm SET "School Name" = 'George V. LeyVa Intermediate' FROM satscores AS T1 WHERE T1.cds = frpm.CDSCode AND CAST(frpm."Free Meal Count (K-12)" AS REAL) / NULLIF(frpm."Enrollment (K-12)", 0) > 0.1 AND T1.NumGE1500 > 0

base_pg_sql: SELECT T2."School Name" FROM satscores AS T1 INNER JOIN frpm AS T2 ON T1.cds = T2.CDSCode WHERE CAST(T2."Free Meal Count (K-12)" AS REAL) / NULLIF(T2."Enrollment (K-12)", 0) > 0.1 AND T1.NumGE1500 > 0
base_question: Give the names of the schools with the percent eligible for free meals in K-12 is more than 0.1 and test takers whose test score is greater than or equal to 1500?
base_evidence: Percent eligible for free meals = Free Meal Count (K-12) / Total (Enrollment (K-12)

gt.condition: SELECT frpm.cdscode FROM frpm, satscores AS T1 WHERE T1.cds = frpm.CDSCode AND CAST(frpm."Free Meal Count (K-12)" AS REAL) / NULLIF(frpm."Enrollment (K-12)", 0) > 0.1 AND T1.NumGE1500 > 0

question: Update the first name of the administrator to 'Laurel' for the school run by Gibson where the free meal rate for students aged 5-17 is 0.20174165070056915.
evidence: Eligible free rates for students aged 5-17 = `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)` / `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`
SQL: SELECT CAST(T2.`Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)` AS REAL) / T2.`Enrollment (Ages 5-17)` FROM schools AS T1 INNER JOIN frpm AS T2 ON T1.CDSCode = T2.CDSCode WHERE T1.AdmFName1 = 'Kacey' AND T1.AdmLName1 = 'Gibson'
pg_sql: UPDATE schools SET AdmFName1 = 'Laurel' FROM frpm AS T2 WHERE schools.CDSCode = T2.CDSCode AND CAST(T2."Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)" AS REAL) / NULLIF(T2."Enrollment (Ages 5-17)", 0) = 0.20174165070056915 AND schools.AdmLName1 = 'Gibson'
base_pg_sql: SELECT CAST(T2."Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)" AS REAL) / NULLIF(T2."Enrollment (Ages 5-17)", 0) FROM schools AS T1 INNER JOIN frpm AS T2 ON T1.CDSCode = T2.CDSCode WHERE T1.AdmFName1 = 'Kacey' AND T1.AdmLName1 = 'Gibson'
base_question: What is the free rate for students between the ages of 5 and 17 at the school run by Kacey Gibson?
base_evidence: Eligible free rates for students aged 5-17 = `Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)` / `Enrollment (Ages 5-17)`

gt.condition: SELECT schools.cdscode FROM schools, frpm AS T2 WHERE schools.CDSCode = T2.CDSCode AND CAST(T2."Free Meal Count (Ages 5-17)" AS REAL) / NULLIF(T2."Enrollment (Ages 5-17)", 0) = 0.20174165070056915 AND schools.AdmLName1 = 'Gibson'

pg_sql: UPDATE member SET phone = '403-555-1310' FROM event AS T1, attendance AS T2 WHERE T1.event_id = T2.link_to_event AND T2.link_to_member = member.member_id AND T1.event_name = 'Women''s Soccer'
base_pg_sql: SELECT T3.phone FROM event AS T1 INNER JOIN attendance AS T2 ON T1.event_id = T2.link_to_event INNER JOIN member AS T3 ON T2.link_to_member = T3.member_id WHERE T1.event_name = 'Women''s Soccer'

base_question: What kind of expenses incurred by members who have X-Large in size of tee shirt?
base_evidence: kind of expenses refers to expense_description; t_shirt_size = 'X-Large'

gt.condition: SELECT expense.expense_id FROM expense, member AS T1 WHERE T1.member_id = expense.link_to_member AND T1.t_shirt_size = 'X-Large'

question: Change the layout to 'aftermath' for all cards that have the keyword 'Flying'.
SQL: SELECT layout FROM cards WHERE keywords = 'Flying'
pg_sql: UPDATE cards SET layout = 'aftermath' WHERE keywords = 'Flying'
base_pg_sql: SELECT layout FROM cards WHERE keywords = 'Flying'
base_question: What are the card layout of cards with keyword of flying?

gt.condition: SELECT cards.id FROM cards WHERE keywords = 'Flying'

question: Update the name of all cards that have a text box to 'Ignorant Bliss'.
evidence: have a text box refers to isTextless = 0
SQL: SELECT DISTINCT name FROM cards WHERE isTextless = 0
pg_sql: UPDATE cards SET name = 'Ignorant Bliss' WHERE isTextless = 0

question: Update the element value to 'si' for the atom that is associated with bond ID 'TR000_1_2'.
evidence: TR000_1_2 is the bond id;
SQL: SELECT T1.element FROM atom AS T1 INNER JOIN connected AS T2 ON T1.atom_id = T2.atom_id WHERE T2.bond_id = 'TR000_1_2'
pg_sql: UPDATE atom SET element = 'si' FROM connected AS T2 WHERE atom.atom_id = T2.atom_id AND T2.bond_id = 'TR000_1_2'
base_pg_sql: SELECT T1.element FROM atom AS T1 INNER JOIN connected AS T2 ON T1.atom_id = T2.atom_id WHERE T2.bond_id = 'TR000_1_2'
base_question: What are the toxicology elements associated with bond ID TR000_1_2?
base_evidence: TR000_1_2 is the bond id;

gt.condition: SELECT atom.atom_id FROM atom, connected AS T2 WHERE atom.atom_id = T2.atom_id AND T2.bond_id = 'TR000_1_2'

question: "Change the type of all events to 'Social' where the remaining budget is greater than 30 USD."
evidence: remaining budget more than 30 USD refers to remaining > 30
SQL: SELECT T1.type FROM event AS T1 INNER JOIN budget AS T2 ON T1.event_id = T2.link_to_event WHERE T2.remaining > 30

question: Update the ruling text to 'In a Two-Headed Giant game, Rankle's second mode causes each team to lose 1 life twice.' for all cards with unknown power (null or '*') where the current ruling text mentions 'triggered ability'.
evidence: unknown power cards refers to power is null or power = '*';contain info about the triggered ability refers to text contains 'triggered ability'
SQL: SELECT T2.text FROM cards AS T1 INNER JOIN rulings AS T2 ON T1.uuid = T2.uuid WHERE (T1.power IS NULL OR T1.power = '*') AND T2.text LIKE '%triggered ability%'
pg_sql: UPDATE rulings SET text = 'In a Two-Headed Giant game, Rankle’s second mode causes each team to lose 1 life twice.' FROM cards AS T1 WHERE T1.uuid = rulings.uuid AND (T1.power IS NULL OR T1.power = '*') AND rulings.text LIKE '%triggered ability%'

base_pg_sql: SELECT T2.text FROM cards AS T1 INNER JOIN rulings AS T2 ON T1.uuid = T2.uuid WHERE (T1.power IS NULL OR T1.power = '*') AND T2.text LIKE '%triggered ability%'
base_question: How many unknown power cards contain info about the triggered ability
base_evidence: unknown power cards refers to power is null or power = '*';contain info about the triggered ability refers to text contains 'triggered ability'

sets: text = 'In a Two-Headed Giant game, Rankle’s second mode causes each team to lose 1 life twice.'
gt.condition: SELECT rulings.id FROM rulings, cards AS T1 WHERE T1.uuid = rulings.uuid AND (T1.power IS NULL OR T1.power = '*') AND rulings.text LIKE '%triggered ability%'

question: Update the set code to '5ED' for the set that has a release date of 07/13/2007.
SQL: SELECT T2.setCode FROM sets AS T1 INNER JOIN set_translations AS T2 ON T2.setCode = T1.code WHERE T1.releaseDate = '2007-07-13'
pg_sql: UPDATE set_translations SET setCode = '5ED' FROM sets AS T1 WHERE set_translations.setCode = T1.code AND T1.releaseDate = '2007-07-13'
base_pg_sql: SELECT T2.setCode FROM sets AS T1 INNER JOIN set_translations AS T2 ON T2.setCode = T1.code WHERE T1.releaseDate = '2007-07-13'
base_question: State the set code of the set with release date of 07/13/2007?

gt.condition: SELECT set_translations.id FROM set_translations, sets AS T1 WHERE set_translations.setCode = T1.code AND T1.releaseDate = '2007-07-13'

evidence: SUBTRACT(Date from stats_badges, CreationDate) where DisplayName = 'Zolomon';
SQL: SELECT T1.Date - T2.CreationDate FROM badges AS T1 INNER JOIN users AS T2 ON T1.UserId = T2.Id WHERE T2.DisplayName = 'Zolomon'
pg_sql: UPDATE users SET DisplayName = 'Ram Rachum' FROM badges AS T1 WHERE T1.UserId = users.Id AND T1.Date - users.CreationDate = '83 days, 1:05:11'
base_pg_sql: SELECT T1.Date - T2.CreationDate FROM badges AS T1 INNER JOIN users AS T2 ON T1.UserId = T2.Id WHERE T2.DisplayName = 'Zolomon'
base_question: How long did it take the user, known by his or her display name 'Zolomon' to get the badge? Count from the date the user's account was created.
base_evidence: SUBTRACT(Date from stats_badges, CreationDate) where DisplayName = 'Zolomon';

gt.condition: SELECT users.id FROM users, badges AS T1 WHERE T1.UserId = users.Id AND T1.Date - users.CreationDate = '83 days, 1:05:11'

question: Update the name of all alien superheroes to 'Scorpia'.
evidence: alien superheroes refers to race = 'Alien'; name of superhero refers to superhero_name;
SQL: SELECT T1.superhero_name FROM superhero AS T1 INNER JOIN race AS T2 ON T1.race_id = T2.id WHERE T2.race = 'Alien'
pg_sql: UPDATE superhero SET superhero_name = 'Scorpia' FROM race AS T2 WHERE superhero.race_id = T2.id AND T2.race = 'Alien'
base_pg_sql: SELECT T1.superhero_name FROM superhero AS T1 INNER JOIN race AS T2 ON T1.race_id = T2.id WHERE T2.race = 'Alien'
base_question: Give the name of the alien superheroes.
base_evidence: alien superheroes refers to race = 'Alien'; name of superhero refers to superhero_name;

gt.condition: SELECT superhero.id FROM superhero, race AS T2 WHERE superhero.race_id = T2.id AND T2.race = 'Alien'
